title: Sam Burgess will QUIT the NRL over a serious shoulder injury
text:
NRL star Sam Burgess has ditched his own retirement announcement to party on a beach while his devastated fans contemplate life without him.

South Sydney announced the forward's retirement from rugby league on medical grounds at a press conference on Wednesday afternoon.

But instead of fronting the cameras, Burgess was 12,000km away in Cabo, Mexico, where he was hours earlier spotted sunning himself at the beach.

Burgess' retirement capped off a tumultuous fortnight beginning with his second split with his wife Phoebe and her father taking out an AVO against him.

Burgess' retirement will cap off a tumultuous fortnight beginning with his second split with his wife Phoebe (pictured together) and her father taking out an AVO against him

He suffered what turned out to be a career-ending shoulder injury in April that festered throughout the season into a 'chronic condition'.

Instead of having him showing up in person, the club released a lengthy statement attributed to Burgess where he thanks fans for their support over the years.

'I have loved absolutely every minute; the highs, the lows; the Grand Final; coming home; my injuries; my dates with the judiciary. It really has been a fantastic ride,' it read.

'This decision was one of the hardest decisions I've had to make in my life, however the decision was out of my hands essentially. I am no longer able to be myself day in, day out on the training field and consequently the playing field.

'I will not be playing in the NRL next season. My time has come to an end. I'm excited for my next chapter in life whatever that may be.'

Burgess thanked his family but failed to mention his estranged wife Phoebe by name.

'My family have been by my side the whole way, on and off the field. I love you all so much,' the statement read.

The 30-year-old didn't look too bothered about never pulling on a Rabbitoh's uniform again as he strolled shirtless by the surf about 3pm on Tuesday local time

Burgess walked with his brother Luke and Luke's girlfriend through the marina and along the sand to the Mango Deck beach club on Medano Beach

The 30-year-old didn't look too bothered about never pulling on a Rabbitoh's uniform again as he strolled shirtless by the surf about 3pm on Tuesday local time (9am Wednesday AEDT).

Burgess walked with his brother Luke and Luke's girlfriend through the marina and along the sand to the Mango Deck beach club on Medano Beach.

There he met friends including Bachelorette star Jackson Garlick who were having lunch and drinking, staying about 20 minutes before ducking out the back.

He is believed to have headed back to his hotel where Luke, who left the NRL in 2016 last playing for Manly, and his girlfriend followed soon after.

Luke and his other half sunbathed in the afternoon at the hotel but there was no sign of Sam, who was thought to be in his room.

I'm sure you'll agree with me, the spirit of South Sydney is alive and will live long after me. It will always be a huge part of my heart. Just like it is yours. Love always, Sam Burgess, 1073.

The rugby league player from West Yorkshire, England, is one of the NRL's biggest and most marketable stars.

Last year he signed a three-year-contract worth $3.6 million that runs through 2022 and it is unclear how much of that he will receive.

He suffered the devastating injury during a round five game against the New Zealand Warriors in April.

It plagued him for the rest of the season but Souths hoped he could come through, despite fears he may never play again.

Burgess will, at least on the field, be best remembered for gutting out a broken cheekbone to lead the Rabbitohs to victory in the 2014 NRL Grand Final.

Earlier this month Burgess was banned from going within a kilometre of his estranged wife Phoebe's country hideout after an alleged row with her father

Last week Burgess was banned from going within a kilometre of his estranged wife Phoebe's country hideout after an alleged row with her father.

Burgess was visiting his two children at the NSW southern highlands estate last Saturday when he allegedly got into an argument with Mitchell Hooke.

Mr Hooke reportedly asked the NRL superstar to leave the family's three hectare Glenquarry farm - which Burgess did - but police were called about 5pm.

Sam Burgess career stats * NRL Games: 182 * Tests: 26 (24 for England, 2 for Great Britain) * Tries: 44 * Premierships: 1 (2014) * 2013 RLIF prop of the year * 2014 Clive Churchill Medallist * 2014 Dally M lock of the year * 2014 RLIF player of the year * Three-times South Sydney player of the year (2014, 2016 and 2017) * Rugby union Tests: 5 (including England's 2015 World Cup campaign)

Officers filed an interim apprehended violence order (AVO) against Burgess, and court documents revealed Burgess is now barred from coming close to the home.

Burgess is also banned from coming within a kilometre of any other place where the retired mining executive lives or works.

He was also hit with standard AVO conditions which prevent him from stalking, intimidating or assaulting Phoebe's father.

A NSW Police spokeswoman said police are investigating and 'there are no reports of any injuries.'

Burgess is due before Moss Vale Local Court on November 6, where a magistrate could confirm the AVO or dismiss it in its entirety.

There is no suggestion Burgess did anything wrong by visiting the property.

Doctors advised Burgess to retire immediately after the troublesome left shoulder injury halfway through the season, but he played on anyway.

To correct the chronic condition he would have needed to sit out eight months, then have a surgery followed by a 12 year recovery time.

The 2020 and 2021 seasons would be written off and a very rusty Burgess would be attempting a comeback aged 32 in the last year of his contract.

The glamour couple separated for the second time just weeks ago

South Sydney was already reeling from a series of departures by star players that will see it struggle to compete next season.

Greg Inglis had to call time on his career earlier this year, and fellow former captain John Sutton called it quits at the end of 2019.

Damien Cook, Cameron Murray and Adam Reynolds are expected to be the leading contenders to take over the captaincy.

The team is yet to formally request cap dispensation but it's believed it soon will given it is a new injury stopping Burgess playing again.

The fact he is retiring before the beginning of the next rugby league year on November 1 could mean his entire wages are stricken from the 2020 cap if their application is successful.

Burgess would also be allowed to collect his entire $3.6 million contract over the next few years if the NRL plays along.

Burgess played 182 games for Souths and was Clive Churchill Medallist in their drought-breaking 2014 grand final win.
description: NRL star Sam Burgess is quitting rugby league as he continues to struggle with a serious shoulder injury, capping off a tumultuous fortnight beginning with his second split with his wife Phoebe.
authors: Nic White For Daily Mail Australia
